title: Wikibase docker-compose Generator
subtitle: A docker-compose.yml builder for wikibase-docker
prolog_description:
The Wikibase docker-compose Generator is a tool that will help you setup a wikibase based on Docker quickly and easily.

Docker encapsulates components or services inside containers. You can get more informations here.

If you want to setup docker now you can use this link.

You will also need docker-compose, which is included in Docker community edition, so most likely you won't need to install it separately. You can find Docker Compose here.
components_question: Mediawiki with Wikibase and MariaDB(an SQL server) will automatically be included. Which additional components do you want to include?
components_elasticsearch_help: Elasticsearch is a more advanced search, which can be used for faster and more accurate search in your Wikibase. See here for more
components_wikibaseQuickstatements_help: QuickStatements is a tool that can automatically create and update Wikibase items or statements. See here for more
components_wikibaseQueryService_help: The Wikibase Query Service allows SPARQL based queries to be run on your data. See here for more
portsConfigurationDescription: Ports are endpoints for communication between several application. A port is identified by a non negativ number, which is unique. Also there are so called "well known ports", which are addessed by numbers in the range from 0 to 1023, so you cannot use numbers in this range.
wikibasePort: Which port to use for Wikibase?
wikibaseBlazegraphPort: Which port to use for Blazegraph?
wikibaseProxyPort: Which port to use for the proxy of Wikibase?
wikibaseFrontendPort: Which port to use for the user interface of the Wikibase query service?
wikibaseQuickstatementsPort: Which port to use for Quickstatements?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespacePro: Which namespace do you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespaceIte: Which namespace do you want to use for items in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixProper: Which prefix do you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixItem: Which prefix do you want to use for items in Wikibase?
mediawikiSiteName: How would you like to name your MediaWiki?
mediawikiAdminName: How would you like to name your MediaWiki admin account?
mediawikiAdminPassword: Provide your admin account with a password.
databasePort: Which port to use for the database?
databaseName: How would you like to name the database?
databaseUser: What is the name of your database user?
databaseUserPassword: Provide your database user with a password.
finish_description: You can now run your Wikibase Docker environment. To learn how to do this, refer to the manual
